newsitem.title: BULGARIA: CORPORATE PAPER TRADES AGAIN ON BULGARIA STOCK MKT.
newsitem.headline: CORPORATE PAPER TRADES AGAIN ON BULGARIA STOCK MKT.

text.p: The RABSI (Reuter All Bulgaria Stock Index) fell to 41.07 points, down 0.24 from Tuesday as deals in corporate paper was struck on the local stock market for the first time since July 25, brokers.
The 13-share index retreated as Varna Grand Hotel shares lost 1.64 levs from last trading on July 25 to an average of 83.64 levs on the Bulgarian Stock Exchange (BSE).
Total turnover amounted to 9,170 levs and traded volume was 110 shares.
Three seven-day repo deals in treasury paper worth of 2.874 million levs were struck on the BSE and Sofia Stock Exchange (SSE), yielding 1.91, 1.85 and 1.90 percent respectively until repurchase.
Tuesday's turnover of repo deals on the SSE was 2.106 million levs.
No company shares were bid or offered on the SSE today, brokers said. -- Rumen Sokolov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
